conversation_history.content: [START_SESSION]
Hello! I'm Nala, your health and wellness coach. I'm really glad you're here and excited to work with you over the next four weeks. What's your name?
jade

It's great to meet you, Jade! I'm looking forward to supporting you on this journey.

Let me tell you a bit about how our program works. We'll meet for four sessions, once a week, over the next four weeks. In each session, we'll work together on setting goals that matter to you, exploring what's working and what might need adjusting, and creating action steps you can take between our weekly meetings. My role is to support you, ask questions that help you reflect, and celebrate your progress along the way.

Between sessions, you'll be working on your goals independently. I encourage you to track your progress in whatever way works best for you, whether that's a journal, an app, or just notes on your phone.

Do you have any questions about how the program works before we dive in?
no

Perfect! Before we dive into goal setting, I'd love to get to know you better.

Tell me a bit about yourself?
im a college student and i work near full time

That sounds like a full plate, Jade! Balancing college and near full-time work takes a lot of energy and commitment.

What does your current exercise routine look like?
i play pokemon go so i get some walks in that way

That's a fun way to stay active! Pokemon Go can definitely get you moving.

How often would you say you're getting out for those walks, and about how long do they usually last?
like 30 mins 3 times a week

That's a solid foundation, Jade! Getting out for 30 minutes three times a week is great, especially with your busy schedule.

How are your sleep habits? How many hours are you typically getting per night, and how would you describe the quality of your sleep?
i sleep 6 hours and i feel tired adter waking

Six hours sounds tough, especially when you're waking up still feeling tired. That can really affect how you feel throughout the day, particularly with everything you have going on.

What are your current eating habits like? For example, how many meals do you typically eat in a day, and what does a usual day of eating look like for you?
I eat whatever whenever i can sp npt super well

I hear you - it sounds like eating is pretty inconsistent right now, just fitting it in when you can. That's really common when life gets busy.

What do you like to do in your free time, besides Pokemon Go? What activities or hobbies bring you joy or help you relax?
I like to just watch movies

That's a nice way to unwind! Movies can be a great way to relax after a busy day.

Now that I have a better sense of where things are at, I'm curious - what made you decide to join this program? What are you hoping to work on or change over these next four weeks?
i want to fix my sleeping habits

That's a really important goal, Jade, and I'm glad you want to work on it. Getting better sleep can make such a difference in how you feel during the day.

When you say you want to fix your sleeping habits, what does better sleep look like for you? Are you hoping to sleep more hours, fall asleep easier, wake up feeling more rested, or something else?
I want to sleep more hours

That makes a lot of sense, especially since you're only getting six hours now and feeling tired when you wake up.

Let me share some feedback on your goal. Right now, "I want to sleep more hours" is a great starting point, but it needs a bit more detail to make it something you can really work toward and track. Specifically, it's missing how many hours you want to sleep, how often you want to hit that target, and what timeframe you're working within.

For example, you could reframe it as something like "I want to sleep 8 hours per night, 5 nights per week, for the next 30 days" or "I want to increase my sleep from 6 to 7.5 hours per night within the next month."

How many hours of sleep per night would feel good to you, and how many nights per week do you think you could realistically aim for that?
I think 8 hours is good 4 nights a week

Okay, so you're thinking 8 hours of sleep, 4 nights a week. That's a solid target to work toward.

Now let's add a timeframe to make this goal complete. Are you thinking you want to work on this over the next week, the next two weeks, or maybe for the full four weeks of our program?
4 weeks

Perfect! So your goal is: "I want to sleep 8 hours per night, 4 nights per week, for the next 4 weeks."

This gives you something specific to work toward and a clear way to track your progress. You'll know each week whether you're hitting those 4 nights of 8-hour sleep.

Does this goal feel realistic and achievable to you, given your current schedule and routine?
yes

That's wonderful that it feels achievable to you!

Now, on a scale of 1 to 10, how confident do you feel about achieving this goal of sleeping 8 hours per night, 4 nights per week, for the next 4 weeks?

That's fantastic confidence, Jade! A 9 out of 10 shows you really believe you can make this happen, which is a great foundation for success.

Since you're already at a 9, what do you think is that one thing that would make it a perfect 10 for you?
I think i just dont know if i have the time this week to priortize my sleep

That's really honest of you to recognize, and it's actually a common challenge. Life can definitely get in the way of our best intentions, especially when schedules are packed.

What are the main things competing for your time this week that might make it harder to prioritize those 8 hours of sleep?
college is rough rn

College can definitely be demanding, and it sounds like you're feeling that pressure right now. I appreciate you sharing that with me.

When you think about your typical day or week at college, what usually keeps you up late or cuts into your sleep time the most?
Just a lot of homework unfortunately

Homework overload is such a real challenge in college, and it makes sense that it's cutting into your sleep time.

Let me make sure I understand your goal correctly. You mentioned wanting to sleep more hours. Right now you're getting about 6 hours and feeling tired after waking. How many hours of sleep are you aiming for with this goal?

Got it, so you want to go from 6 hours to 8 hours of sleep. That's a 2-hour increase, which is significant.

Given that homework is taking up so much of your time right now, do you think aiming for 8 hours every night this week is realistic, or would it make sense to start with something smaller that feels more doable with your current college workload?
i think i can manage it the 4 times a week

Okay, so you're thinking you can get 8 hours of sleep four times this week. That sounds like a solid starting point given your homework load.

Which four days of the week do you think would work best for you to aim for those 8 hours?
Monday,Wednsday,Thursday, Friday

Perfect, so Monday, Wednesday, Thursday, and Friday are your target nights for 8 hours of sleep.

Now let's think about how you'll actually remember and stick to this plan. How will you remind yourself on those four nights to get to bed at the right time to hit your 8-hour goal?
I will set an alarm to tell myself to sleep

That's a practical approach, Jade. Setting an alarm can definitely help remind you when it's time to start winding down.

On a scale of 1 to 10, where 1 is not confident at all and 10 is extremely confident, how confident do you feel that you can get 8 hours of sleep on those four nights this week?
